item.title: Dollar Weakens as Market Ponders Fed Rate Cuts in 1H
item.description: The U.S. dollar is trading weaker as investors ponder the possibility of a first interest-rate cut by the Federal Reserve in the first half of 2024, said DHF Capital.

item.title: Holding Core Bonds Makes Sense Amid Growth Concerns, Says Goldman Sachs AM
item.description: Core fixed income assets can help balance portfolios through episodes of geopolitical instability and growth volatility, given higher yields can provide a potential buffer, Goldman Sachs Asset Management said.

item.title: U.K. Public-Sector Borrowing Climbs
item.description: U.K. public-sector borrowing was higher than expected in October, an indication that Chancellor Jeremy Hunt will find little headroom to pass tax cuts in Wednesday’s autumn budget statement.

item.title: EU New Car Sales Rise, Boosted by EVs
item.description: New car registrations in Europe increased 15% in October, driven by demand in France, Italy and Spain, and a 36% rise in fully-electric vehicle sales.

item.title: Stellantis, CATL Agree Battery Supply Deal
item.description: Stellantis has signed a memorandum of understanding with CATL for the supply of EV batteries in the European market, which could lead to a joint venture with equivalent contributions.

item.title: Nikkei Edges 0.1% Lower Amid JPY Strength
item.description: Japan’s Nikkei Stock Average edged 0.1% lower to close at 33354.14 amid JPY strength, which hurts the overseas earnings of Japanese exporters.

item.title: For Argentina, Dollarization May Work Better on YouTube Than in Reality
item.description: Anarcho-capitalist President-elect Javier Milei is right that the country desperately needs dollars. But his economic plan for getting them may be the wrong one.

item.title: Tired Ukrainian Troops Fight to Hold Back Russian Soldiers: 'They Come Like Zombies'
item.description: Russia is taking heavy casualties in the mud of eastern Ukraine as it presses to encircle the city of Avdiivka.

item.title: Israeli Military, Border Residents Press Netanyahu to Eliminate Hezbollah Threat
item.description: The prime minister is resisting demands to take action at the Lebanon border, while issuing warnings to the Iran-backed army.

item.title: An appeals court signaled that it would affirm but potentially narrow a gag order imposed on Trump in the criminal case alleging he conspired to overturn his 2020 election loss.
item.description: An appeals court signaled that it would affirm but potentially narrow a gag order imposed on Trump in the criminal case alleging he conspired to overturn his 2020 election loss.

item.title: Workers at two Wells Fargo bank branches launched unionization efforts, shifting attention of a resurgent labor movement to an industry that has historically been cool to it.
item.description: Workers at two Wells Fargo bank branches launched unionization efforts, shifting attention of a resurgent labor movement to an industry that has historically been cool to it.

item.title: Bayer shares fell sharply after the company stopped a late-stage study for a blood-thinning drug early because of lack of efficacy and was told to pay $1.56 billion in a lawsuit relating to its Roundup weedkiller.
item.description: Bayer shares fell sharply after the company stopped a late-stage study for a blood-thinning drug early because of lack of efficacy and was told to pay $1.56 billion in a lawsuit relating to its Roundup weedkiller.

item.title: Major U.S. stock indexes advanced, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow industrials gaining 0.7%, 1.1% and 0.6%, respectively.
item.description: Major U.S. stock indexes advanced, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow industrials gaining 0.7%, 1.1% and 0.6%, respectively.

item.title: A company run by former New York Stock Exchange President Tom Farley said it acquired crypto-focused media company CoinDesk.
item.description: A company run by former New York Stock Exchange President Tom Farley said it acquired crypto-focused media company CoinDesk.

item.title: Americans' support for abortion access is at one of the highest levels on record since nonpartisan researchers began tracking it in the 1970s, results from a Wall Street Journal-NORC poll show.
item.description: Americans’ support for abortion access is at one of the highest levels on record since nonpartisan researchers began tracking it in the 1970s, results from a Wall Street Journal-NORC poll show.

item.title: Amazon launched a program to train millions of workers in artificial-intelligence skills as the tech giant seeks to gain an edge in a battle for talent with Microsoft, Google and other companies.
item.description: Amazon launched a program to train millions of workers in artificial-intelligence skills as the tech giant seeks to gain an edge in a battle for talent with Microsoft, Google and other companies.

item.title: China is narrowing one of the biggest gaps separating the U.S. and Chinese militaries as it makes advances in its submarine technology and undersea detection capabilities, with major implications for American military planning for a potential conflict over Taiwan.
item.description: China is narrowing one of the biggest gaps separating the U.S. and Chinese militaries as it makes advances in its submarine technology and undersea detection capabilities, with major implications for American military planning for a potential conflict over Taiwan.

item.title: A federal appeals court ruled Monday that voters alleging discrimination in election rules don't have a right to sue, a decision that could have a sweeping impact on voting rights if adopted by other courts.
item.description: A federal appeals court ruled Monday that voters alleging discrimination in election rules don’t have a right to sue, a decision that could have a sweeping impact on voting rights if adopted by other courts.

item.title: Israel is shifting the focus of its military campaign to southern Gaza, where it will likely face the hardest stage of the six-week-old war as it seeks to crush Hamas and recover hostages amid a deepening humanitarian crisis.
item.description: Israel is shifting the focus of its military campaign to southern Gaza, where it will likely face the hardest stage of the six-week-old war as it seeks to crush Hamas and recover hostages amid a deepening humanitarian crisis.

item.title: The future of startup OpenAI was in jeopardy as the vast majority of employees threatened to quit if the board that fired its chief executive, Sam Altman, didn't resign itself and restore him to the position.
item.description: The future of startup OpenAI was in jeopardy as the vast majority of employees threatened to quit if the board that fired its chief executive, Sam Altman, didn’t resign itself and restore him to the position.
